sentences.en: Christine squirmed uncomfortably in her chair.
sentences.cn: 克里斯蒂娜坐在椅子上不自在地扭来扭去。

sentences.en: Don't try to squirm out of your responsibility for children.
sentences.cn: 别想逃脱对孩子的责任.

sentences.en: Each time he recalled this he wanted to squirm in his seat.
sentences.cn: 每当想到这个问题他都辗转不安.

sentences.en: He gave a feeble shrug and tried to squirm free.
sentences.cn: 他无力地耸耸肩，扭动身体想要挣脱。

sentences.en: I wanted to squirm, but I held still.
sentences.cn: 我想动一动, 但是我却一动没动.

sentences.en: I would inwardly squirm at the unwanted attention.
sentences.cn: 我的内心痛苦不安,真不想让人看到.

sentences.en: If you bought me the proper - sized corset, I wouldn't have to squirm.
sentences.cn: 如果你给我买了合适的胸衣, 我根本不会乱动.

sentences.en: It made him squirm to think how he'd messed up the interview.
sentences.cn: 他想到面试时自己表现得那麽差劲儿,心里真不是滋味儿.

sentences.en: Mentioning religion is a sure way to make him squirm.
sentences.cn: 一提宗教就肯定会让他感到窘迫不安。

sentences.en: Natives will cringe and squirm with embarrassment at such brashness.
sentences.cn: 对于这种轻率鲁莽,当地人会因尴尬而战战兢兢.坐立不安.

sentences.en: Right now , serious programmer - type readers are beginning to squirm in their seats.
sentences.cn: 说到这里, 严肃的程序员立即开始局促不安.

sentences.en: So I pretended everything was fine and tried not to squirm.
sentences.cn: 我假装一切如常,并保持不动.

sentences.en: The boy tried to squirm free.
The question of whether or not to bring a gift often makes guests squirm.
sentences.cn: 是否带礼物的问题常使客人不安.

sentences.en: Yet beneath these attention - grabbing markers of gender parity, there's plenty to make a feminist squirm.
sentences.cn: 然而,下面这些注意抢占标志性别平等, 有很多女权主义者,使蠕动.

sentences.en: Yet I would never look at the table full of leftovers , let alone squirm over them.
sentences.cn: 尽管是我从那些摆满剩菜的桌子旁边经过,但我从不去看桌子.

sentences.en: You'll never squirm out of the charge this time.

trans.tran_en: to twist your body from side to side because you are uncomfortable or nervous, or to get free from something which is holding you

trans.tran_cn: 蠕动，扭动，难为情，局促不安

trans.tran_en: to twist your body from side to side because you are uncomfortable or nervous, or to get free from something which is holding you
